attributes.action: All British expats in EU should have the Right To Vote in a Second Referendum
attributes.background: It is not democratic to vote on whether to leave or stay in the EU if British Citizens living in EU countries for longer than 15 years do not have the right to vote. We still have British Citizenship and Passports, and therefore should not be excluded.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens living in the EU a vote concerning UK membership of it.
attributes.background: We, the long-term British residents of EU countries, will shortly lose our status as EU citizens, seriously compromising our continued stay in our host countries.  We have had no say in the referendum process, having lost the right to vote. We ask as UK citizens to add our votes to the referendum.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking Except in Designated Areas
attributes.background:
There has been lots of scientific research done on passive smoking. It shows that passive smoking is just as bad as actually smoking. When someone is smoking nearby you're breathing in their smoke as well. 
Therefore smoking should be banned outside as well as inside except in designated areas.

attributes.action: Provide the Queen and Country with a New Royal Yacht
attributes.background: I have always believed that Britannia should have been replaced. It was always more than just a Royal Residence. It was a vessel that sailed the World and was a great example of what made and makes the UK great.

attributes.action: Give citizens of the UK the ability to initiate their own nation-wide referenda.
attributes.background: After an appropriate sized petition is raised, of maybe 400,000 people, a nation-wide referendum is called to annul any act of parliament, law or treaty in effect within the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The word democracy stems from the Greek word, dēmokratía, comprising two parts: dêmos "people" and kratos "power". Without a demos, there is no democracy. But people without power is not democracy either.

Our current system of government is known as "representative democracy". That phrase is a misuse of the word democracy. People do not hold power: that system cannot by definition be a democracy.

attributes.action: Scrap car tax and put 1p on a litre of fuel.
attributes.background: Scrapping car tax (ved) and putting 1p on fuel will ensure everyone who drives pays the same, regardless of engine size, and no one can evade paying excise duty on fuel.

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Call a second EU Referendum based on independently verified Facts.
attributes.background: Based on the realization that significantly misleading and inaccurate misinformation and untruths have been officially used and admitted to influence the EU referendum. We demand the first referendum be declared void and a second and final referendum be held considering the following:-
attributes.additional_details:
•One communication be compiled and sent out to all the population containing the same agreed number of pages for each party.
•Each party be limited to three sections to complete along the lines of the following:
1. THE FACTS – These must be independently verified.
2. ASPIRATIONS 
3. A CLEAR REALISTIC PLAN OF HOW THESE ASPIRATIONS WILL BE ACHIEVED. 	
Illustrations limited to statistical and information that they contain independently verified.
We demand proven facts, not deception.

attributes.action: Negotiate and hold a new referendum on moving from EU membership into the EEA.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum has divided the country and caused chaos. To restore stability we propose that HM Government begins immediate and rapid negotiations on the terms of the UK’s possible transition to the EEA, and then holds a second referendum offering three choices: EEA, EU or neither.
attributes.additional_details:
The EEA is the European Economic Area. It includes the EU countries and Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. It allows them to be part of the EU’s single market.
Young people, who voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU, need hope. 16 and 17-year-olds should have the right to vote in the second referendum.
Ireland created strong and democratic precedent for a second EU referendum. Their 2008 referendum rejected the Lisbon Treaty. The government then renegotiated, and a second referendum passed it.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: The UK should rejoin the European Free Trade Association as soon as possible.
attributes.background: It is in the best interest of the UK to continue to have free trade with Europe, and it is important for our economy to have a smooth transition when leaving the EU. Rejoining EFTA would allow this. It would help to reunite Leave and Remain supporters and reduce the risk of a breakup of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on the European Free Trade Association:
http://www.efta.int/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Free_Trade_Association

Some opinions on this:

http://www.brugesgroup.com/alternatives-to-the-eu/42-issues/alternatives-to-the-eu/61-71-said-they-would-prefer-britain-to-leave-the-eu-and-join-efta

http://www.iea.org.uk/in-the-media/press-release/iea-presents-four-possible-paths-for-britain-outside-the-eu

http://www.adamsmith.org/evolution-not-revolution/

attributes.action: Create a law preventing the independence of any part of the United Kingdom
attributes.background: After Britain has voted to Leave the European Union, we are faced with the possible break of the UK's union. We must stop this. The UK can stand on its two feet, but cannot if it is split. London, Northern Ireland and Scotland may possibly leave the UK. Let's stop this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Reform section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act
attributes.background:
Signatories of this petition ask the Government to remove any reference of the following from section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act

“Grossly offensive” , “Indecent”, “obscene” , “Causing annoyance”, “inconvenience”,  and “needless anxiety”.
attributes.additional_details:
A number of cases have made it to the national press of people being arrested for “Grossly offensive” jokes and comments on twitter and FB. Section 127 and Section 1 both have wording that is extremely vague and ambiguous. Both acts can be read here:

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/21/section/127
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1988/27/section/1

Free expression is the corner stone of a free democracy. Reform these laws to remove ambiguity and respect that vital human right.

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Give police the powers to enforce immediate punishments to noisy neighbours
attributes.background: On two occasions now, my family have been victim to noisy neighbours, playing music and shouting throughout the night. The severity of this needs to be addressed and police need to be given powers to immediately seize equipment or enforce other methods to give the victim some respite.
attributes.additional_details: Action needs to be taken on this issue as individuals do become suicidal due to the lack of support from authorities and police. It is not widely documented how much of an effect anti-social and noisy neighbours can have on people. While environmental services can investigate the issue, this can take a long time and people get desperate. The police need powers to tackle the situation right there and then. If their music is too loud, seize the equipment instantly. Harassment, take them into custody.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to implement a Universal Basic Income scheme in the UK.
attributes.background:
Instead of running an expensive mean tested benefits system; instead pay adult in the UK a Basic living income to end poverty within the UK.

This will reduce the cost of administering the welfare state.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to lock toilets during lesson times and break times
attributes.background: My daughters and other children at school are forced to wait up to 20 minutes for someone to come and unlock the school toilets - this is not right. There are children with bladder difficulties and girls who need toilet access. Do you think it's appropriate to have them locked? I certainly do not.

attributes.action: The UK should remove the moderator (silencer) licensing requirement for firearms
attributes.background: Moderators (silencers/suppressors) are designed to reduce the volume of a gunshot. Modern shooters & those around them deserve the best in hearing protection, and moderators can help provide this. They should be treated as a safety measure, without the need for expensive FAC variation.
attributes.additional_details:
In many countries throughout the world, moderators are treated as devices to protect the hearing of shooters and those around them.

Removing the requirement for a moderator to be held on a Firearms Certificate would help shooters to further protect their hearing, and would reduce the effect the sound of shooting has on other people & the environment. Furthermore, it would also help reduce police workload as police would no longer have to process certificate variations for moderators.

attributes.action: Urgently bring forward the planned works to the A417 missing link / Birdlip Hill
attributes.background: The A417 birdlip hill (Gloucester) is a notorious accident black spot and is gridlocked on a daily basis, which has a huge impact on commuters, businesses and visitors to the area. The planned works to improve the road much be brought forward as soon as possible to rectify this horrendous situation
attributes.additional_details: http://a417missinglink.co.uk

attributes.action: Better pay for support workers and carers they are the backbone of this country.
attributes.background: Carers, supported living and especially nursing homes, are the backbone of this country. Right now, the care sector and social welfare sector is suffering to the point of collapse. It is the backbone of this country. In order to attract a quality of care, the rate of pay MUST be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/social-care-network/2015/jan/20/care-workers-better-pay-conditions

This article in the guardian more or less sums up the whole situation. 

If we are to attract a quality of staff that is prepared to actually "care" then we must give those staff the incentive to come and do so. Right now, the wage is slow low it is almost in design to attract abuse, negativity and bad care. And those who do care are pushed to their limit financially and emotionally. This must change.

attributes.action: Bring the unaccompanied minors and others in the refugee camp in Calais to UK
attributes.background: To ask the Home Office to issue humanitarian visas to all those in the Calais camp (and the smaller number in Dunkerque) and arrange safe transport to Britain. As a priority, the unaccompanied minors should be brought to Britain as per the Dubs amendment.
attributes.additional_details: Two weeks ago, I went on a six day visit to the camp, having taken some aid for children and others and spent time with the people in the camp. There are businesses set up by inhabitants of the camp, some semblance of normality in an abnormal situation. There are schools, cafes and drop-in centres for the young. But the French authorities seem hell-bent on destroying such necessary amenities.  It is harassment of the most vulnerable people. Give these people the right to settle in UK.

attributes.action: Esophageal cancer awareness day!
attributes.background:
Esophageal cancer is rare aggressive form of cancer.
People with esophageal cancer may experience the following symptoms or signs. Sometimes people with esophageal cancer do not show any of these symptoms. 
having a mandatory camera at the age of 50-55 is ideal
attributes.additional_details:
*Difficulty and pain with swallowing, particularly when eating meat, bread, or raw vegetables.
*Even liquid may be painful to swallow.
*Pressure or burning in the chest
*Indigestion or heartburn
*Vomiting
*Frequent choking on food
*Unexplained weight loss
*Coughing or hoarseness
*Pain behind the breastbone or in the throat

We need to make the endoscope camera mandatory for persistent cases, also we need to spread the word so having a national esophageal awareness day would be awesome!

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Government to HONOUR Britain's Worst Maritime Disaster the RMS Lancastria
attributes.background: The Lancastria sank 17th June 1940 taking with it between 5-10,000 men women and children plus pets making it Britain's Worst maritime Disaster. France have recognised the sinking, Scotland has recognised the sinking with a medal plus monument on the Clyde 2011. What have the British done-NOTHING!
attributes.additional_details: After many years writing to the British Government regarding recognition for "Britains Worst maritime Disaster!" The government choosing every year to ignore pleas and cries of not only the survivors of the disaster but also the families of those lost. Last year stand in for our Prime Minister Osborne finally acknowledged that the disaster ever took place and stated it was now "appropriate" to recognise the sinking which has brought strange feelings of mistrust and anger amongst its Nation.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: Ensure political advertising carries an ASA disclaimer
attributes.background: Unlike any other advertising, political advertising is exempt from the remit of the Advertising Standards Authority. The public expects all adverts to be legal, decent and truthful, including political adverts.  All political advertising should carry a disclaimer about exemption from ASA standards.

attributes.action: Call for a UK referendum on the abolition of the "unelected" UK monarchy.
attributes.background: We have elected to leave the EU. One of the many arguments for the case of the UK leaving was to disconnect ourselves from the influence of unelected officials making choices on our behalf. So why stop with the EU? Let us now have a referendum on the relevance of the monarchy in our new modern UK.

attributes.action: Ban smoking on footpaths, walkways and public places
attributes.background: Passive smoking is becoming a serious health issue, specifically in urban area. Every morning, thousands of non-smokers have to face passive smoking while going to work as other people smoke on footpaths and walkways. A large number of people do not use designated smoking zones.
attributes.additional_details:
A quick look at this article from Cancer Research UK will tell us how dangerous passive smoking can be - http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

Unwanted passive smoking on the streets of major UK cities is causing health issues that are not very easy to detect in early stages. Overall, passive smoking is affecting the health of non-smokers living or working in urban areas in a significant way.

attributes.action: Change to (CCRs) Regulations 2013 to an prevent online fraud
attributes.background: There is loop hole being exploited by a small number of online buyers, where if the seller cannot prove delivery (ie sent WITHOUT ONLINE TRACKING) the buyer claims non-delivery getting money back and the goods (theft). This is costing traders a small fortune in claims.
attributes.additional_details: What I propose is if the seller offers a tracking service and the buyer declines that service, then the risk should pass from the seller to the buyer (PROVIDING THE SELLER CAN PROVE DISPATCH. ie Royal Mail Certificate of posting) and no claims will be accepted for non-delivery. This will make no difference for goods damaged in transit claims.

attributes.action: Call on the government to encourage Concorde to return to the skies.
attributes.background: Concorde was an amazing supersonic passenger aircraft which was in service between London, Paris, New York and Washington DC. Unfortunately it stopped its services in 2003, making an end to supersonic travel. It's ridiculous that today it takes 8 hours to go to New York when before it was only 3.

attributes.action: Make our Waters Safe- Licensing and Alcohol Regulation of Watercraft
attributes.background: The Railways & Transportation Safety Act of 2003 in Section 80 already starts to cover the control of being under the influence, all it needs is to be signed by the Minister of Shipping (Robert Goodwill MP) for it to be enforced. This can then also be expanded into licensing watercraft.
attributes.additional_details:
British Waters are one of only a few that don’t require a license to operate leisure craft on the water, nor is there any regulation on being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Most European countries, Australia and the USA all require a license to operate a vessel on the water. The US Coastguard name alcohol in their top five contributing factors of accidents. 
Lives at sea matter. We have legislation for our roads, why not our waters. 
For more info: www.facebook.com/makeourwaterssafe

attributes.action: To stop fining and criminalising people that are homeless/sleeping rough.
attributes.background: Homeless people are homeless for a reason. We should provide support for them rather than fining them large amounts of money which they evidently in most cases do not have.

attributes.action: Require that MPs leaving their political party resign their seat immediately.
attributes.background:
This gives the electorate of that constituency the proper opportunity to express their mandate again, rather than having to wait for the next general election. 

It also provides the resigning MP with a mandate to continue (as an independent, or in another party), should they be re-elected.

attributes.action: Andrea Leadsom should be forced to apologise for her comment on male carers.
attributes.background: The Minister for the Environment should be forced to come before the house and apologise to both the house and men across the UK for her statement that hiring men to look after your children was more of a risk as the persons hired "could be paedophiles".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/andrea-leadsom_uk_5788a201e4b08078d6e8699c?9zveu3di has the quote:

“As an employer we’re not, let’s face it, most of us don’t employ men as nannies, most of us don’t,” she told the paper. “Now you can call that sexist, I call that cautious and very sensible when you look at the stats. Your odds are stacked against you if you employ a man. We know paedophiles are attracted to working with children. I’m sorry but they’re the facts.”

attributes.action: Education should be Free. Scrap University fees. Scrap & write off student loans
attributes.background:
Education is a right. It should be more accessible to everyone regardless of their backgrounds. Without Education society can never prosper.

Student loans should also be scrapped or written off. They charge too much interest.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/may/17/george-osborne-pledge-to-scrap-very-unfair-tuition-fees-comes-to-light

attributes.action: Stop the HMRC phone number being a premium rate and make it free.
attributes.background:
This number is mainly used by people on a low income, elderly people on pensions and those that are registered disabled.
It's charging the people that are less fortunate and really can't afford it.
And average call to the tax office I have found has been 30minutes minimum

attributes.action: Legislation to curb newspapers from knowingly printing factual inaccuracies.
attributes.background: Given the major complaint during the EU referendum was one of factual inaccuracies there should be a way to hold newspapers to account without limiting freedom of the press. If a lie is told on the front page the apology/correction should also be on the front page thus making them more accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The press in the UK is currently beyond reproach. It can print a headline that is totally untrue and currently only be forced to print a small correction where most will not see it. 
Recognising the freedom of the press is sacrosanct we must act to ensure they are accountable in a way that does not impinge upon this. Forcing them to give equal space to which the falsehood was printed under regulation by an independent body would help deter them from knowingly printing lies for political gain.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on using Single Transferable Vote in Parliamentary Elections
attributes.background:
After the last General Election we awoke to a Parliament which nearly 2/3 of the country had voted against. Now, in an age of smaller and more specialised political parties, voters are punished for backing their actual favourite candidates and parties.
We want representation, we need reformation.
attributes.additional_details:
Single Transferable Vote (STV) is a type of Proportional Representation which still allows for local candidates and representatives through use of ranges.

For more info on the imbalance between votes and seats in our current Parliament watch goo.gl/bZwsxJ

For more info on STV and why this can lead to better representation watch goo.gl/wB7ybJ

For more info on STV and it's Pros and Cons from the Electoral Reform Society visit goo.gl/urkDXf

attributes.action: Freeze funding for students fallen ill until recovered enough to return.
attributes.background: It is completely unfair on those students who fall ill to have to pay for their education should they want to return to study in recovery. This applies to many illnesses but especially mental illness. This petition asks for the funding to be frozen (for up to two years) until they're able to return.

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: ALL coffee, tea , cocoa, chocolate sold in UK to be Fair Trade certified.
attributes.background: Free of EU Trade Restrictions - this petition calls for legislation to end Slavery in the tea, coffee and cocoa farming industries. It calls upon the Government to pass a law requiring ALL tea and coffee and cocoa (chocolate) sold in the UK to be Fair Trade (or Rainforest Alliance) Certified.
attributes.additional_details:
Ask yourself: Is it right that tea that is sold in the UK may be picked by people in bonded labour who have to live amongst their own sewage? Is it fair that the chocolate you buy as an after-school treat for your children contains cocoa picked by a farmer who can’t afford to send her own children to school?

I have dreamt for many years that Britain would one day act to end modern Slavery. Such a law will demonstrate that the UK is outward looking and compassionate, and truly define a new era!

attributes.action: Make the National Insurance Number required to sign a Parliament Petition.
attributes.background:
In the highlight of the recent EU Referendum there is/was a Petition calling for a 2nd Referendum that received millions of signatures which received a lot of scrutiny.

This is because it is all too easy to sign a petition, there is no way to confirm that the person signing is a British Citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
So my proposal is to make the National Insurance Number a required piece of information to sign a petition.

This way ONLY British Citizens over the age of 16 years of age can sign a Petition and they can only sign it once, as opposed to the current format in which a person only requires a different email to sign the same petition again.

attributes.action: Allow Medicinal Cannabis (Savitex) for all neurological conditions in the UK.
attributes.background: The Welsh NHS have authorised the use of Savitex medicinal cannabis for MS sufferers only in Wales to treat muscle spasticity. However, there are many people in the UK with other neurological conditions such as Cervical Myelopathy and Myelomalacia who also suffer with severe muscle spasms.
attributes.additional_details: There is no magic cure for muscle spasms. There are certain medicines such as Gabapentin, Pregabalin, Baclofen ect but many patients do not benefit from them orally. To treat severe muscle spasms, many patients are offered the insertion of a Baclofen Pump instead. A recent cost analysis by the MS Foundation has found that it is cheaper to prescribe Savitex than insert and regularly maintain a Baclofen pump. Savitex trials have proved positive in reducing muscle spasms. Please support our campaign - it is cost effective. MS sufferers are allowed the drug why can't all people suffering with neurological conditions in the UK have access to it ?

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: We want the UK to appoint a dedicated minister for young people.
attributes.background: Young people in this country, are not being heard, and not being catered for by government. We constantly get shafted at the expense of the silver haired vote because of the perception that we aren't engaged with, or care about politics. We do care! We want somebody accountable to deal with us.
attributes.additional_details:
Ever since the 2008 recession, young people have been beaten down with a stick and told to put up.

The abolishing of EMA allowance
Trebling university fees
Taking away housing benefit for 18-21 year old's
New living wage excluding  under  25's

Are all examples of government policy designed to take away from young people in order to give to other demographics of the vote.

All in the age of low wages and astronomical rent and house prices. 
It's time we engage and let our voice be heard.

attributes.action: Stop British Government discriminating against people with Disabilities
attributes.background: Cody has been on ancestral visa, he has now applied for indefinite leave to remain. Part of this application is a life in the UK test and an English test. Cody has documentary proof that he suffers from severe Dyslexia and Specific Language Impairment. The Government has denied him an excemption.
attributes.additional_details: Under their own rules he should have been granted an exception. Cody has now been refused indefinite leave to remain due to not sitting the test. This is a blatant discriminatory act against people with Disabilities. Under the UK Disabilities Act of 2010. Please support this petition otherwise this means deportation where he has no family or friends with no means of support.

attributes.action: Change mandatory jail sentence for rape, rather than community service.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the jail sentence length and to rule out community service. The victims of these charges deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Two women under 16 were raped by a man aged 17 (now 18) and he got off with 18 months community service. He put these two girls and their families through hell and he basically got away with it. What is community service going to do to help these two girls go about their lives without having to keep looking over there shoulders. How does having an unstable mind allow this man to not get jail time.
